user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_pool_allocate:
```c
void *
MHD_pool_allocate (struct MemoryPool *pool,
                   size_t size,
                   bool from_end)
{
  void *ret;
  size_t asize;

  mhd_assert (pool->end >= pool->pos);
  mhd_assert (pool->size >= pool->end - pool->pos);
  mhd_assert (pool->pos == ROUND_TO_ALIGN (pool->pos));
  asize = ROUND_TO_ALIGN_PLUS_RED_ZONE (size);
  if ( (0 == asize) && (0 != size) )
    return NULL; /* size too close to SIZE_MAX */
  if (asize > pool->end - pool->pos)
    return NULL;
  if (from_end)
  {
    ret = &pool->memory[pool->end - asize];
    pool->end -= asize;
  }
  else
  {
    ret = &pool->memory[pool->pos];
    pool->pos += asize;
  }
  _MHD_UNPOISON_MEMORY (ret, size);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
mhd_assert (pool->size >= pool->end - pool->pos);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.8 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the assertion only reads members of the object pointed to by the pointer parameter (pool->size, pool->end, pool->pos). It does not modify the pointer itself or any of the members in this statement, so Rule 17.8 is not violated.
